event.title: attached to C. W. Gwynn's account of his 1908

data.event: The map attached to C. W. Gwynn's account of his 1908/09 triangulation survey of southern Ethiopia shows that Gore had a telegraph station.

event.title: the 1960s, experimental tea plantations were started

data.event: During the 1960s, experimental tea plantations were started around Gore in the 1960s, and a number of them thrived.

event.title: the 1960s, and a number of them thrived

data.event: During the 1960s, experimental tea plantations were started around Gore in the 1960s, and a number of them thrived.

The Russian explorer Alexander Bulatovich stopped here 21 November 1896, expecting to meet Ras Tessema, who was away campaigning against the Mocha; Ras Tessema had not returned when Bulatovich left on 31 December.

The Russian explorer Alexander Bulatovich stopped here 21 November 1896, expecting to meet Ras Tessema, who was away campaigning against the Mocha; Ras Tessema had not returned when Bulatovich left on 31 December.
With the growing prosperity of the port town of Gambela, and the growth of the Baro River route to Sudan, Gore likewise prospered, holding two market days a week.
Civet cat oil was also a significant export at the time, Pankhurst noting that Ras Tessema exported 42 kilos in 1910.
